subtitle.translate: Monsters, Survival, and the Rebirth of the Night

description: &&7[Apocalypse]&&r Zombies may form hordes to hunt you down, break blocks to get to you, and pounce to attack you. /6/Be careful! /6/

&&7[SIHYWTCAMD]&&r Basically, /4/almost every hostile mob has been reworked/4/, from small changes to huge ones. Some of them are inspired by the Bedrock edition, which is a bit different (and often harder) than the Java one. There are now also a few achievements related to mobs in general.

Normally in Minecraft, the sleeping system is quite stupid. Once you have a bed, you can effectively avoid all potential challenge of the night. As well, sleep is almost required, due to Phantoms spawning when you haven't slept for a while. This makes zero sense.
In /6/Comprehensive/6/, sleeping works differently and in a less annoying way.
/9/Tiredness/9/ is a value attached to every player.
Your current Tiredness level can be seen within your inventory by hovering over the "Zzz" icon.
When your /9/Tiredness/9/ level reaches 100%, you will be able to sleep. At 0 - 99%, you will not be able to sleep. After successfully sleeping, your Tiredness will be /6/reset/6/ to 0%.
The maximum level of Tiredness is /6/500%/6/.
When your tiredness level reaches 300%, Phantoms have a chance to spawn on you.
As your tiredness level increases, /4/more Phantoms will spawn at once/4/.
Other than that, /d/Tiredness has no effect. You won't be forced to lose stamina faster, or any other negatives. It's just a way to discourage sleeping away every single night. /d/

There are also /e/Potions of Liveliness/e/ and /9/Potions of Drowsiness/9/ that will decrease or increase your /9/Tiredness/9/ gain in order to stay up late or fall asleep faster. You can check the recipes for these in REI.

On servers, only 50% of players are required to sleep in order to skip the night - this means if players on the server sleep too often, you may need to stay awake a few nights a week. /c/Combined with the more difficult mobs, this means building strong walls and defensible bases is important again!/c/

&&7[True Darkness]&&r Nighttime darkness is determined by /c/the phase of the moon/c/. When it's a full moon, it's bright, and easy to see threats coming from afar. If it's a New Moon....well, you might not want to be out in /c/the pitch black/c/. Thankfully, there are tools to combat the darkness:

&&7[LambDynamicLights]&&r Held items like &&3Torches&&r and &&3Lanterns&&r will &&dlight up their surroundings&&r. Press &&7[&&r&&6F&&r&&7]&&r to swap one to your &&3off-hand&&r, where it can't be placed accidentally.

&&7[YIGD]&&r On death, a &&3Grave&&r will be placed that &&dcontains your items&&r. Simply &&6Right-Click&&r the grave to restore them. When respawning, you'll receive a &&3Compass&&r that points to your grave.
&&7[Friendly Fire]&&r You can't accidentally hit your tamed animals like &&aHorses&&r or &&aWolves&&r.
